resources.string:
APIs configured here will be used for both auto-reporting and manual-reporting.

- Privacy
The API endpoints will see your:

  - IP address
  - TLS and TCP fingerprints (which may reveal your Android version)
  - The reported number (including your country code)

Nothing else will be reported.

- Manual reporting
If any API is enabled here, tap a number in the call history, there will be a report button.

The number will be reported to all APIs.

- Auto reporting
Report delay
When a call is blocked, there will be a one-hour time buffer before it\'s reported. If the number is allowed later due to repeats or dialed back within this time buffer, it\'s considered a non-spam number and the reporting will be canceled.

Report type
1. It will not report:

- SMS numbers or content
- Allowed numbers
- Testing
And following blocked types:
- Contact Regex
- Contact Group Regex
- Database
- Meeting Mode
- Instant Query (to prevent the API endpoint\'s number from being leaked to other competitors)

2. It will report numbers blocked by:

- Non-Contact
- STIR Attestation
- Number Regex

3. One exception:

When it\'s blocked by Database and the number was originally added by API query, it will be reported back to that API to increase the rating score.

For example, if the number was added by an API query from check.com, it will only report to check.com, not to others.com.
